TopicTitle: HOCgaming's THAT'S NO MOON! Base - Craft Submission Thread

Articles.Content:
Craft Name: Growler MEV Mk7 (Mun Exploration Vehicle)

Screenshot: http://i.imgur.com/6IwXDf1.png

.CRAFT File: http://www./?edbb1yjkyn4ecrj

Total Mass: 4.055

Total Parts: 80

My Name: ConkerXD

The Growler MEV Mk7 can reach about 20-21 m/s and still be able to turn, but will flip if you turn hard. It is very stable and will not get destroyed if you accidentally flip it. It has all the science equipment except for the long range comm dish. I managed to put all the parts inside, which is a small space, and it is capable of running all equipment and stay at a fully charged battery.

it has two small ladders on the back next to the docking port, so if any kerbals are just sitting out in a random place, you can go and pick them up and bring them back.

it should be able to dock at the standard height, but you may want to adjust the docking port, which is on the back, so that it is the right height. That should be the only thing that may need adjustment.

So I'm kinda confused as to what you mean by the mission brief

Yeah, I was a bit vague. Basically, I want to see if we can use the memorial as a prop for a REALLY powerful cannon- It's not likely to budge an inch, but I want to know how difficult setting up the cannon would be.

Yeah, I was a bit vague. Basically, I want to see if we can use the memorial as a prop for a REALLY powerful cannon- It's not likely to budge an inch, but I want to know how difficult setting up the cannon would be.

OK, I get it now, I'll try something out, although if you still want to use my other craft that's fine.

Edited May 27, 2013 by minerman30

Now that I understand what you mean, I have a cannon for you, the Kerblifter Mk1!

It uses a Skipper engine for thrust and has a backplate and landing legs to secure itself against the memorial.

http://imgur.com/7hRcHBY

It weighs about 30 tons and has 58 parts, and you could push it against the memorial with the tractor once it's landed and stable.

You could add docking ports and use the cannon itself to land, and then refuel it once landed.

Craft file:

http://www./?gzg38oxann9e2u4

Also, I haven't tested it yet, but it should work once it's up against the memorial.

-Minerman30

Edited May 27, 2013 by minerman30

http://imgur.com/ZRd3jJ6

Well, you have a base, but you don't have a food supply.

-170 parts (can be easily reduced)

-4.21 Tonnes

Made by Random Eye

Download:

http://www./download/od424v2pz8z0ef1/Hotdog_Stand.craft
Interesting... Working on a VTOL Spaceplane Drop ship, that could be adapted to Munar activities... I'll be back!

This vehicle is a lightweight transporter for kerbals. It holds up to four kerbals and random junk in the main, open-topped compartment. It's docking port should be able to drag trailers and what-not behind it, but you may need to adjust it. I have no time in my schedule to add a landing method for it, but it has it's center of gravity nearly centered (it's slightly higher, relative from the rollcage to the wheels) to the docking port at the rear. It can reach 20 m/s in about 11.5 seconds on kerbin, and with testing on the Mun (I used hyperedit to get it there, mainly because of the "no time to develop lander" part.) Godspeed to you, kind sir.

(The Vehicle is made in the SPH.)

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zwnb7uz54s39srm/Groveler%20Manned%20Transport.craft?v=0mcn

Not a craft submission, but a reply to your video asking for build ideas.

Since having junk in orbit is a known issue, why not make something to deorbit the craft that can't be reused?

This is the Advanced Aerospace station resupply module. Now you may be wondering why its a station resupply module, well this can take kerbals from LKO to the moon station and dock. From there the kerbals would get out and chill in the station, waiting for the lander to take them down. Kerbals on the moon base can use the cannon to get to the station and then home. You need the transfer stage you usually have because it only has RCS. It looks like this, without the transfer stage:http://i.imgur.com/6huUEzJ.png

file VAB:https://www.dropbox.com/s/mdyk4j2w56tz0ap/AA%20Moon%20Base%20Resupply.craft

I present the KERBAN THROWER a center lined kerbal launcher. Using a skipper engine it has thrown a kerbal up to 7,500 meters on the mun. It is movable by itself and uses a cushion plate with lander legs to wedge itself against a rock. ( #1= toggle ladders, #2= toggle engine.) there is no mechjeb on it I only used it for weight purposes.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/b1yixtk9h0enpg9/KERBAN%20THROWER.craft

Hello Harv!! I have a Utility here for you that I think you (And the Kerbals you throw up to the station) may like! They may get home sick and want to watch the moon or other things, so I build an observation deck you can use! It uses two regular docking ports, and even has a tug on the top! This tug is used to control the deck and the RCS on deck, but can be used for other deeds.

Name of utility: Observation Deck

Picture of the Observation Deck (In VAB):

Total mass: Ooo, that's a nice one, only weighing in at 28.05 Tons! This thing is super lightweight, and the glass is even shatterproof!

The Craft File: http://www.fileswap.com/dl/8FzjerZeuf/ (I would have it in KSP but it won't let me post attachments D: But needless to say this file should work).

My Name: The Outcast Gamer

Extra: Some struts may not be needed, but I'm very careful with my station (I blew up one of them anyway, oh well).

If you decide to use my craft, thank you! And have fun launching your Kerbals into orbit and letting them watch their base pass over again

Edited May 29, 2013 by TheGamerOutcast

I know that you have a beacon but, it would never hurt to have a long range scanner/ radio tower. I made this because I have not seen any radio dishes in you videos. Thank you for your time.

Making your submission - Post your entries in a reply to this thread, to be valid your require the following factors:

Name of Utility:

Radio Tower

http://www.fileswap.com/dl/wAWhsP5QaK/

Your Name:

Travis

Name of Utility - Pie Fighter

Screenshot -

Total Mass of Utility - ~20

Utility's .CRAFT file - http://www./download/rgt4kgunjumfw8s/Pie_Fighter.craft

Your Name- "Chumley"

N.B. Action group "1" is mapped to fire the "light weapons"

It is not really equipped to land, but it's centers are alined well enough to set er down on the tailpipe iff'n ya need to. It does have a docking port and top o the line ASAS. NO RCS though.. Feel Free to augment it as you wish.

Cheers!

-Chumley

We here at Kepetech, Finland are proud to announce our first product release; the Kepetech SS-tug. It is a custom design made specifically for the That's no Moon! Base -mission that has been such a great success and show of Kerbal power, technology and control of the entire galaxy. The design combines a handy space tug for moving stuff around in orbit with an undockable drive section that can be used for a longer trip around the solar system or to act as a munar surface-to-orbit elevator. Both sections are completely autonomous, self-sustaining, have their own RCS and function without eachother. We offer three versions of the design, one of which is manned. All models come with docking lights and landing legs for easier operation and versatility. KSP 0.20 parts are used to reach unprecedented levels of high technology. The designs have been tested and they withstand the stresses of a lift to orbit. Only some Kerbals were harmed during product testing.

Kepetech SS-tug

Manned craft with a great view to the main docking port straight from the cockpit. Even a Kerbal can dock when he has our SS (Space Station)-tug! Drive section features four external seats for retrieving stranded/lost Kerbals.

80 parts, 39.27 Kerbal Weight Units

Image: http://i.imgur.com/Q7O8nRQ.jpg

.craft: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/17005234/Kepetech_SS-tug/KepeTech%20SS-tug.craft

Kepetech SS-tug L unkerbaled

An unmanned lighter version with completely autonomous function. One command seat with a great view to the docking port is provided for those important dockings you don't want any pesky computer to handle.

62 parts, 26.17 Kerbal Weight Units

Image: http://i.imgur.com/I8h821A.jpg

.craft: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/17005234/Kepetech_SS-tug/KepeTech%20SS-tug%20L%20unkerbaled.craft

Kepetech SS-tug H unkerbaled

Space tug on steroids! This beefed-up unmanned version has all the same important features as the lighter model, but with twice the thrust for the drive section for faster travel and easier navigation with heavier loads. The space station tug section has twice the RCS for extra longevity in the coldness and loneliness of space.

71 parts, 36.57 Kerbal Weight Units

Image: http://i.imgur.com/Seceeul.jpg

.craft: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/17005234/Kepetech_SS-tug/KepeTech%20SS-tug%20H%20unkerbaled.craft

Part counts and weights are as reported by KSP 0.20 info window on the world map view.

Please note that you need to provide your own lift stage, our design does not have the power required to lift itself to any sort of orbit on Kerbin! We take no responsibility for any harm or damage caused to property or Kerbals by the use of our product.

Edited May 31, 2013 by Kepe

*consolidated and deleted the double post into the below one, feel free to delete this moderators*

Edited May 31, 2013 by scien30

Part Count: 211

Mass: 24.21 mass units

Name: Orbital Ladder Station.

.craft file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/7aeq2zzkf2uj5hc/orbital%20ladder.craft?n=13105666

after watching an episode of Vsauce(

) i had an idea for a orbital ladder! each bit is self sustaining with the new robotic disc core thing. its vastly customizable in that you can split off sections and add whatever you want inbetween. such as more docking ports for a massive station or observation decks every so often. and with it being only about 20 MU theres a whole 20 more MU to meet the requirements for HOC's utilities.

screens: Orbital Ladder Station

http://imageshack.us/f/39/compartmentalspaceladde.png/

now there are NO kerbals on the segments so theres no danger of immediate kerbal death. have fun guys. alter this design as any of you see fit. it is yours to tinker with and make better.

Edited May 31, 2013 by scien30

hey guys, apparently im on a modular kinda binge here, thought about minecraft and block based building, i propose a challenge to you Kurbonaughts out there. use this basic building block ive made and construct something.. neat.

27 parts

about 3.89 mass units

named: Kerbo-block

screens:

the four small struts are for reference when positioning out in space, they are the "front" of the cube and arent required persay if you wish to remove them but they do help very slightly in balancing it.

Inside:

the topmost docking port is to attach to the delivery ship. *edit* i removed the top docking port, for more versatility when choosing the delivery method.

pros:

easy delivery of one or more in one trip

infinite building possibilities *as long as its in space*

cons:

useless during launch and positioning can be a hassle

nowhere to house a kerbin, so minimal space station use *unless you build around it*

.CRAFT file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/edqqt7rlx7xge5z/Minecraft%2C%20in%20space.craft

this is for anyone to use and muck about with. have fun fellas.

Edited May 31, 2013 by scien30
